name: unsynchronized
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not happening together, at the same or right time, or in the expected way: The unsynchronised traffic lights along major roads leave many drivers frustrated.
not having been made to show the same time: You will want to know the exact time when something has happened, and so an unsynchronised clock in your system will lead to problems. Related word
synchronize
More examplesFewer examplesSome hens lay double-yolked eggs as a result of unsynchronized production cycles.Stokowski's famous sound includes unusual arrangements of instruments and unsynchronized bowing in the strings.Ventricular fibrillation is a condition in which the two hollow spaces (or "ventricles") in the heart contract in a rapid, unsynchronized way.
